name: Empanadas with Bill's Vegan Chili
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, and baking powder.
Cut in the cold coconut oil or vegetable shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add vinegar and cold water gradually, mixing until a dough forms. Knead for about 3–5 minutes until smooth.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to about ⅛-inch thickness.
Cut out circles (about 4–6 inches in diameter).
Place 1–2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of each circle.
Fold the dough over the filling, forming a half-moon shape. Press the edges with a fork or pinch them closed.
Brush the tops with plant-based milk and sprinkle smoked paprika for color.
Arrange on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 20–25 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
